courseDescription:
Job hunting, also known as job searching, can be stressful, time-consuming and discouraging. The biggest issue is a lack of trust and communication between job seekers and employers. This course will teach you everything you need to know to succeed in your job search. We have prepared the guidelines and procedures required to create a professional curriculum vitae and cover letter that will sell your best attributes. These include the hard, soft and online skills essential for a successful career. Financial management and budgeting are examples of hard skills that can help you keep your job and advance within your organisation.

Networking is an essential strategy for career development, advancement and can help your job hunting or searching. We will teach you practical networking tips such as passive listening, showing genuine interest in others and what you should do during the pre-interview stage. For example, offering a firm handshake and maintaining good eye contact are two examples of positive body language which make an excellent first impression during the interview. Finally, you will learn about the acts and laws that recruitment agencies in the UK must follow and the importance of hiring the right person for the job.

Familiarise yourself with the critical components of a CV and cover letter and the importance of personal development skills that are essential for any individual who wishes to work with any organisation. This course provides a list of necessary skills needed to advance your career. By taking this course, you will learn how to easily pass an interview or become a networking tycoon in your workplace, which will propel your career forward. Begin this course right away!

  • Lesson Summary

    • Some basic steps to creating a convincing application include learning about the job's required skills, comparing and contrasting the skills, and presenting the skills in writing and verbally.
    • Some of the rules for a successful career include: motivation is the key to success, success takes hard work, learning from your mistakes, and following your dreams.
    • One of the best ways to figure out what you really want to do for a living is to take a step back, reflect on your previous positions and bosses and identify what you liked and what you don’t like.
    • A cover letter is an essential tool that informs a hiring manager about who you are and why you are sending your CV. It is an influential selling tool that will persuade a hiring manager to read your CV and contact you to schedule an interview.
    • The five C’s to be kept in mind when creating a cover letter are concise, confident, customized, creative, and clear.
    • Keeping a cover letter limited to one page, shortening your sentences, making the main points are a few ways to improve its readability.
    • Hard skills help you get and keep jobs and also allow you to advance within your organization. Examples include project management, financial management, and budgeting.
    • In order to research the job market effectively, it is recommended to plan your search, get information to see the big picture.

  • Lesson Summary

    • Networking for the purpose of career advancement implies discussing your goals and dreams with friends, family members, and acquaintances. The key to networking is to reach out to others sincerely and without expecting anything in return. 
    • Some tips for networking include passive listening, showing genuine interests in others, networking everywhere, being proactive, using common interests or settings to kick off conversations, and don’t be a snob.
    • Before the interview, it is important to know thyself, learn about the company, dress professionally, practice, and prepare.
    • Demonstrating good body language by offering a firm handshake, smiling, sitting up straight, facing the interviewer, and maintaining good eye contact are a few pointers to help you make an excellent first impression.
    • in the UK, all recruitment agencies must comply with the regulations set out in the employment agencies act 1973, the conduct of employment agencies, and employment business regulations 2003.
    • Any complaints regarding the recruitment industry are handled by the employment agencies standards inspectorate (EAS).
    • Hiring the right person reduces the costs of the hiring process, maximizes productivity, preserves the morale of the existing team, and protects the image of the employer.
